page.title: 14VEHICLE TESTING,IPSWICH
page.content: All major towns have a place where lorries and vans are tested to see if they are safe to drive on public roads. The Vehicle Testing Station on Landseer Road is run by the Minstry of Transport. Here, lorries are given a very demanding test to see if they have sound brakes,tyres, lights etc. Highly sensitive, computerised machinery, in the hands of an experienced worker, will determine if the vehicle is fit to travel on the roads around Ipswich. The buildings and large parking areas are only 1km from the docks and factory areas, an ideal position as much of the local traffic is that of lorries and vans.
